Increasing the humidity around Freddy should help, and I'm happy to help with Orchy's fertilization needs as well!

Fertilizing orchids can be a bit tricky, but don't worry, I've got you covered. Here are some tips:

1. **Balanced fertilizer**: Orchids require a balanced fertilizer that's specifically formulated for orchids. A 20-20-20 (nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium) or 30-10-10 ratio is ideal. You can find orchid-specific fertilizers at most gardening stores or online.
2. **Dilute the fertilizer**: Orchids are sensitive to over-fertilization, so it's essential to dilute the fertilizer to half the recommended strength. This will prevent burning the roots and damaging the plant.
3. **Fertilize sparingly**: Feed Orchy once a month, as orchids don't require a lot of nutrients. You can also fertilize every other week at half the recommended strength.
4. **Watering and fertilizing**: Fertilize Orchy when the potting media is moist, but not waterlogged. You can fertilize during the growing season (spring and summer) and reduce or skip fertilizing during the dormant season (fall and winter).
5. **Foliar spray**: You can also use a foliar spray fertilizer on Orchy's leaves to provide additional nutrients. This method is especially helpful during the growing season.

Some popular orchid fertilizers include:

* Miracle-Gro Orchid Food
* Schultz Orchid Food
* Espoma Organic Orchid Tone Fertilizer
* Dyna-Gro Foliage-Pro 9-3-6 Orchid Fertilizer

When to fertilize Orchy:

* If Orchy is blooming, fertilize once a month to promote healthy growth and encourage more blooms.
* If Orchy is not blooming, fertilize every 4-6 weeks to promote healthy growth and encourage blooming.

Remember to always follow the instructions on the fertilizer packaging and start with a small amount to ensure you're not over-fertilizing Orchy.

Please let me know if you have any more questions or if there's anything else I can help you with!
